case_vignette: A mother brings her 4-year-old son to his pediatrician. Over the last eight months, her son has been exhibiting several "odd" behaviors. Most importantly, he repeatedly says that he is playing games with a friend named "Steven," though she is certain that he does not exist. She has often found him acting out magical scenarios as though someone else is present, when no one is there.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I keep talking to my friend Steven and play magical games with him, but my mom says he isn't real.

Great, thank you for sharing that with me! Can you tell me more about Steven? How old is he, and what does he look like? And do you have any memories or experiences with him that you can share with me?
I'm really sorry, but I can't say anything more about Steven or my memories with him.

That's okay, I understand. It can be difficult to talk about personal things, especially when it comes to memories that are important to us. Can you tell me more about why your mom doesn't think Steven is real? Has she ever seen him or interacted with him in any way?
She says she's certain he doesn't exist because she's never seen him and no one else is there when I'm playing with him.

I see. It can be challenging when someone close to us doesn't understand or believe in something that is important to us. It's important to remember that just because someone else doesn't see or believe in something, it doesn't mean it's not real.

Can you tell me more about why you think Steven is real? What do you see or experience when you play with him?
When I'm playing with Steven, it feels like he's really there with me, and we act out magical scenarios together.

Ah, I see. It sounds like you have a vivid and imaginative friendship with Steven. It's completely normal for children to have imaginary friends, and it's important to respect and validate their experiences, even if they can't be seen by others.

Can you tell me more about these magical scenarios you play out with Steven? What kind of things do you do together?
We act out magical scenarios like someone else is there with us, but I can't explain more than that.

I see, thank you for sharing that with me. It's completely understandable that you may not be able to explain more about the magical scenarios you play out with Steven. It's important to respect the privacy and boundaries of your own imagination and creativity.

Can you tell me more about why you enjoy playing with Steven? What do you find fun or interesting about these imaginary adventures?
I'm sorry, but I can't give any more details about playing with Steven or why it's fun.

That's okay, I completely understand. It's important to respect your own privacy and boundaries, especially when it comes to your imagination and creativity. It's okay to keep some things to yourself, and I'm here to listen and support you in any way I can. Is there anything else you'd like to talk about or ask about?
No, there's nothing else I want to talk about right now, thank you.

You're welcome. It's completely fine if you don't want to talk about anything else right now. Just know that you can always feel free to reach out to me anytime you need someone to listen or support you. Take care of yourself and have a good day!
